values.value: NIST 800-53 SI-3 (Malicious Code Protection) and SI-7 (Software Integrity) require organizations to identify unauthorized changes to information systems and system components. Configuration changes must be tracked, reviewed, and approved through change management processes.
NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 SI-3 - Malicious Code Protection, SI-7 - Software Integrity

1. Implement change control process requiring approval for all production configuration changes. 2. Track all metadata changes via Setup Audit Trail and Field History. 3. Review high-risk changes (permissions, sharing rules, security settings) within 24 hours. 4. Implement segregation of duties for change approval and implementation. 5. Document all configuration changes with business justification. 6. Conduct monthly reviews of unreviewed configuration changes.
